class_notes:
(Same as AAS 190 3 and AFS 190 1)
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only) What is the relationship between race, citizenship and empire? What are the rights of citizenship and the rights of subjects under imperial rule? What happens to these rights when empire formerly ends? This seminar will explore these questions focusing on Britain in the second half of the 20th century. While British practices of slavery and imperialism have shaped the history of Africans and South Asians for centuries, we will examine the experience of those who have come to identify as Black Britons during the twentieth century.
course_description: Introduces first-year students to the discipline of history, particularly historical sources and methods; aims to improve critical reading, analytical, and writing skills in small group discussion.
schedule_location: M 1pm-3:45pm in Emerson Chemistry Bldg. E504
